intro: Alsine mucronata subsp. funkii, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its low water requirements, it is well adapted to drought conditions and is considered a hardy, resilient species.
